Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I'm trying to configure the control setup for the Bally/Midway arcade proto=
type game Demons & Dragons that was created in about 1982.


I find Demons =
& Dragons intriguing because, although the game uses the Astrocade chipset,=
 it seems to be able to use more than four colors on-screen at once.  There=
's nothing unusual about that really, as you can do that using the Astrocad=
e by moving the left/right color boundary to get up to eight colors on-scre=
en at time.  But this game seems to be using more colors than that.  Again,=
 the Astrocade does have a palette of 256 colors and you can display more t=
han eight colors on the screen at once using machine language interrupts, b=
ut this game doesn't seems to be using this trick.  Take a look and see for=
 yourself.  How are there so colors on-screen at once?

MAME supports Demon=
s & Dragons without sound, but other than that issue it seems to work okay.=
  I'm having problems trying to setup the game's unusual control scheme.  F=
rom what little I can find on the Internet, this game seems to be (sort of?=
) a twin-stick shooter that it setup like this:

Fire - Trackball
Movement =
- Analog joystick

I found someone's diagram of how the control panel suppo=
sedly would look:


http://www.gamesdatabase.org/Media/SYSTEM/Arcade/Contro=
ls/Big/Controls_Demons_-_Dragons_-_1982_-_Bally_Midway.png

[http://www.gam=
esdatabase.org/Media/SYSTEM/Arcade/Controls/Big/Controls_Demons_-_Dragons_-=
_1982_-_Bally_Midway.png]


I'm using an Xbox 360 controller to try to set =
this game up.  I have no issues with the setup of the controls.  I can use =
the twin sticks on the Xbox controller to fire and move my character (a kni=
ght).  However, the analog sensitivity is way too sensitive, even if I turn=
 it down to 1.  The tiniest movement on the controller makes my knight zoom=
 across the screen at top speed.  The game's firing mechanism seems to work=
 okay, but isn't a natural fit for a trackball, as you can only fire in eig=
ht directions (or maybe I've setup the game wrong).

For more information a=
bout Demons & Dragons, here is a 30 second video:


https://www.youtube.com=
/watch?v=3DHgN8bW9WKnQ

[https://www.bing.com/th?id=3DOVP.Ve561ad56cff6496a=
60a889f56424f00f&pid=3DApi]<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DHgN8bW9WKnQ>
=

Demons & Dragons prototype MAME Gameplay video Snapshot ...<https://www.yo=
utube.com/watch?v=3DHgN8bW9WKnQ>
www.youtube.com
This video is a snapshot D=
emons & Dragons (prototype) game sample video. Currently I have over 4000 v=
ideos gameplays completing almost full MAME romset. You ...

Here is anothe=
r video that shows about two-minutes of gameplay:


https://www.youtube.com=
/watch?v=3Dsp5OjNeFlzw

[https://i.ytimg.com/vi/sp5OjNeFlzw/hqdefault.jpg]<=
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dsp5OjNeFlzw>

Game of the day 860 Demons =
& Dragons (????&?????) 1982 ...<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dsp5OjNeFl=
zw>
www.youtube.com
Prototype My blog: http://modellazionev.blogspot.it My =
art Gallery: http://ivanpaduano.deviantart.com.

Here is some overall infor=
mation about the game:


http://www.gamesdatabase.org/game/arcade/demons-an=
d-dragons

Demons & Dragons - Arcade - Games Database<http://www.gamesdatab=
ase.org/game/arcade/demons-and-dragons>
www.gamesdatabase.org
Demons & Drag=
ons on the Arcade. Published by Bally Midway. Developed by Bally Midway. Re=
leased in 1982. View video of game. Screenshot of game. Title screen.

I'd =
love to give this game a try, but without the right control configuration, =
I'm not going to be able to give it a valid attempt.  Has anyone managed to=
 play and control Demons & Dragons in MAME successfully?

Adam

--_000_CY4PR1601MB114152F2DFAD627378D0F709C88C0CY4PR1601MB1141_
